data.title: BOSTON RADIO UPDATE NORTHEAST April 21, 2021 clarkfsmidt@gmail.com (978) 502-6633 www.broadcastideas
data.meta_description: Warmer temps and Covid Shots as Radio brings the promise of the new & credible Roaring ‘20s. The March 2021 PPM survey (March 4-March 31) shows listening habits adjusting to new styles, with a tighter range of fluctuations.
data.text:
Warmer temps and Covid Shots as Radio brings the promise of the new & credible Roaring ‘20s. The March 2021 PPM survey (March 4-March 31) shows listening habits adjusting to new styles, with a tighter range of fluctuations. April research runs April 1 through next Wednesday, the 28th. May dates: April 29-May 26; June is May 27-June 23. Spring diaries for the smaller markets are in the field April 1 - June 23.

Here’s the latest, detailed Boston Update & summaries for NYC, DC, Philly, Long Island and Baltimore; Providence, Hartford with more of the Northeast, when available.

BOSTON. Market #10 6+ Population 4,376,900 Spanish 12% Urban 8.15% 39% of 90 stations subscribe. BOSTON CLUSTER SHARES High & Low Months Underlined. Entercom has changed its name to AUDACY.

June July Aug Sept Oct Nov Dec Hol Jan ’21 Feb March

1. iHeart 35.9 35.2 34.0 33.5 35.3 35.7 34.8 37.5 33.4 33.8 32.3

2. Beasley 21.9 22.8 21.4 21.8 22.9 20.7 20.9 17.3 20.3 21.0 23.0

3. Audacy 13.6 15.1 15.8 15.2 14.0 14.7 15.5 23.7 15.3 14.3 14.7

iHeart retains Boston’s top cluster, up 0.3 from last March as Beasley’s WROR & WBZ/FM take the top shares. BBGI ranks 2nd, down 0.9 from March 2020. Entercom, now Audacy, remains the #3 cluster, 0.6 over March ‘20.

Non-Comms showed a surprise jump by WBUR to move ahead of WGBH 4.6 to 4.4, for the first time in 5 months. Boston Sports (October-March): WBZ/FM advances to 2nd: 6.8-6.2-6.1-5.3-5.7-6.1-6.9 while WEEI/FM goes 2.8-3.0-2.7-2.5-3.5-3.3-3.0 down to #11, just before the start of what could be a very exciting Red Sox Season. 35 of 90 Boston radio stations (39%) subscribe for their results to be published.

BOSTON STATIONS: March Change Range: + 0.8, - 1.2. March Gainers: +0.8 WBZ/FM Sports, + 0.6 WXKS/FM CHR, + 0.5 WBGB/FM Adult Hits, + 0.4 @ WKLB Country, WJMN/FM RhyCHR, WBQT Hot A/C & WNNW-AM Tropical. March Dippers: -1.2 WGBH News/talk, -1.1 WBZ-AM News/Talk, -0.8 WRKO-AM Talk, - 0.5 WBWL Country. BOSTON’S TOP 10 ENTRY SHARES for October 2020/March 2021: 3.1-3.5-3.5-2.9-3.5-3.3-3.7. Top 20 entry October/March 1.3-1.3-1.5, 1.3, 1.4-1.3-1.6.

TOP 10: January/February/March ’21 Share/Cume Rank – calls/format/owner -- trends, local color.

2/3-1/2-1/2 WROR-FM Classic Hits Beasley 7.5-7.5-7.7. #1 share, #2 cume 733-771-804k. Consistent ‘80s based hits.

5/8-4/7-2/7 WBZ-FM Sports Beasley 5.7-6.1-6.9. Up to #2, lead over WEEI/FM: 3.4-2.8-2.2-2.8-3.9. Substantial line-up!

7/2-3/1-3/1 WXKS-FM CHR iHeart 5.3-6.2-6.8. #1 Cume, 754-787-812k. Solid rebound for Boston’s long time #1 CHR.

1/5-1/5-4/9 WBZ-AM News/Talk iHeart 8.2-7.5-6.4. Slides from #1, 426-469-403k #9 cume. iHeart now #3,4,5,8 Tie.

3/4-4/4-5/4 WZLX-FM Classic Rock iHeart 6.1-6.1-6.1. #5 cume 507-524-555k. Slips 1.4-1.6 behind WROR. Still solid.

4/1-7/3-6/3 WMJX-FM A/C Audacy 5.9-5.5-5.6. #3 cume 781-736-784k. Last #1 was for the All Xmas Holiday survey.

9/16-9/11-7/13 WBUR-FM News/Talk Boston U. 5.1-4.4-4.6. Cume 411-359-368k. Jumps ahead of WGBH by a slim 0.2

6/14-6/14-8/16 WGBH-FM News/Talk WGBH Found. 5.6-5.6-4.4. Cume 343-353-301k. Ends run ahead of WBUR/FM.

8/19-8/19-8/19WRKO-AM Talk iHeart 5.2-5.2-4.4. Now tied for 8th. Cume 260-253-223k. Holding in Boston’s Top 10.

11/10-10/8-10/6WKLB-FM Country Beasley 3.3-3.3-3.7. Cume 361-395-453k, good jumps, leads Bull by 1.2-0.7-0.8-1.7.

10/16-10/18-11/18 WEEI-FM Sports Audacy 3.5-3.3-3.0. Cume 302-268-272k. The Hot Sox couldn’t have started sooner.

12/17-14/15-12/12 WBGB-FM Adult Hits Audacy 3.1-2.4-2.9. Cume 297-344-398k. Automated variety ticks back up.

14/5-12/6-13/5 WWBX-FM Hot A/C Audacy 2.5-2.7-2.8. TSL flag, #5 cume 446-454-469k. Hot A/C can get squeezed.

16/9-15-12-14/10WJMN-FM Rhythmic CHR iHeart 2.2-2.3-2.7. Cume 363-359-403k. Once #1 signal, is it dead or alive?

19/13-16/9-15/8 WBQT-FM Hot A/C Beasley. 1.8-2.2-2.6 Cume 350-388-410k. Up, but still low on the totem pole.

13/15-16/16-16/14 WXRV-FM Adult Alternative Northeast 3.0-2.2-2.3. #16 cume at 383k. Big potential in Boston & NH.

17/11-18/18-17/15 WXLO-FM Hot A/C Cumulus 2.1-2.1-2.2. Cume 355-358-345k. Big signal & potential, Boston & West.

18/12-19/10-18/11WBOS-FM Classic Rock Beasley 2.0-1.9-2.1. Cume 350-378-398k. Slight upticks but runt of the litter. 15/18-13/17-19/17 WBWL-FM Country iHeart 2.4-2.5-2.0. Cume 283-290-278k. Had momentum, slips 0.8-1.7 behind KLB

21/21-20/22-20/22 WCRB-FM Classical WGBH Found 1.2-1.3-1.6. Cume 165k-148-173k. Easily much better & brighter.

20/22-21/21-21/20WERS-FM Variety Emerson 1.4-1.1-1.3. Cume 145-149-183k. Spring season share & cume growth.

22/20-22/20-22/21 WKAF-FM Hot A/C iHeart 1.1-1.0-1.0. Cume 189-169-179k. Lost distinction; still can carve a place.

25/23-24/23-22/23 WGIR-FM Rock iHeart 0.8-0.8-1.0. Boston cume 128-134-150k. #1 share at 9.3 in Manchester, NH.

23/26-22-26-24/25 WCTK-FM Country Hall 0.9-1.0-0.9. 97-88-111k Boston cume. February #2 Providence, up 8.1-9.0.

28/24-26/24-25/24 WSRS-FM A/C Rock iHeart 0.4-0.7-0.8. Cume 114-127-149k, #1 Worcester Fall with an 8.0 share.

24/25-24/25-26/27 WHJY-FM Rock iHeart 0.8-0.8-0.7 Boston cume 100-88-108k. Providence February #1, at 9.2.

xx/xx- xx/xx- 27/32 WNNW-AM Tropical Costa-Eagle Boston cume 27,600. First showing for the Salem/Lawrence AM.

29/31-28/30-28/29WUMB-FM (6 signals) Folk UMass 0.2-0.2-0.3, 41-37-47k cume. More connection for UMass mission

29/32-28/28-29/30WHEB-FM Rock iHeart 0.2-0.2-0.2. 29-46-70k cume in Boston. #1 Portsmouth, NH Fall.

29/29-28/27-29/31 WSNE-FM Hot A/C iHeart 0.2-0.1-0.2-0.2, 70-59-61k Boston cume, February Providence #9 at 3.1.

29-34-28/32-29/37 WVEI-FM Sports Audacy 0.2-0.2-0.2-0.2. Boston cume 29-24-29k. February Providence #10, 2.8.

Tied at #29: 29/31 WEEI/FM Stream Sports Audacy Boston cume 21k & 29/31 WWFX-FM Classic Rock Cumulus, 40k.

Tied at #34: 34/33 WXKS-AM Talk iHeart 0.5-0.3-0.1, 57-43-29k cume & 34/35 WCCM-AM Tropical Costa 0.0-0.1, 7k.

NEW YORK (1) 16,110,500. Hispanic 25%. Urban 16.7%. Top Clusters December/Holiday/January/ February/March: Audacy 20.7-19.3-22.2-20.3-21.9, iHeart 25.4-28.1-20.0-16.1-18.9, Spanish Broadcast 9.3-9.0-9.7-10.1-10.4, WNYC 8.3-7.5-8.7-7.6-7.5. Emmis 9.6-9.1-9.0-7.5-4.1 (WBLS/FM Urban is not listed). Top Cume: WLTW A/C 2.689-2.961-3.175 million. Top 5 Stations has WCBS/FM moving to 2nd and WHTZ into 5th: WLTW A/C 8.7-12.8-6.5-6.8-7.1, WCBS/FM Classic Hits 5.2-4.2-5.1-4.8-5.8, WSKQ Tropical 5.7-6.0-5.8-6.1-5.6, WNYC/FM News/Talk 5.1-4.1-4.9-4.5-4.3, WHTZ CHR 3.6-3.8-4.1. March Change Range: +1.0, -0.5. Gainers: +1.0 WCBS/FM Classic Hits, +.4 WQXR Classic, +0.3 @ WLTW A/C, WHTZ CHR, WQHT RhymCHR, WNYL ModAlt Rock. Dippers: -0.5 @ WSKQ Tropical & WXNY Spanish CHR, - 0.2 @ WNYC/FM News/Talk, WPAT Spanish Hits, WCBS-AM News/Talk, WOR-AM Talk. Formats: All major News/Talkers - 0.2 with WNYC/FM 4.3 leading WINS-AM 3.4 and WCBS-AM 2.6. WABC-AM/WLIR-FM went from 1.4-1.6-1.9 to not listed. Classical WQXR leads Alternative WNYL by 0.3. 10 stations bunch up in the 2.0-2.9 range. News/Talk 17.3-16.1-18.5-17.6-14.4 (WABC not listed), Spanish/Tropical 14.2-13.6-15.8-14.4, A/C (Hot/Soft/Urban) 20.8-23.3-20.4-19.2-13.8 (WBLS not listed), ClassicRock/Hits/Oldies 10.0-8.6-11.0-9.6-6.0 (Classic Rock WAQX not listed), Sports 4.8-4.3-4.6-4.1-4.3, Classical 2.4-2.6-1.9-2.3, Jazz 6-0.6-0.5-0.1, Stream 0.4-0.8-0.6-0.9, HD Zip.

WASHINGTON D.C. (7) 5,019,400. Urban 26.8%. Hispanic 16%. Top Clusters December/Holiday/January February & March: iHeart 24.3-27.5-19.6-21.4-23.0, Audacy 9.3-9.7-11.1-10.6-11.1, American University 9.5-8.3-13.4-10.2-9.7, Radio One 9.0-9.6-9.9-10.1-10.5, Hubbard 10.0-8.4-10.2-9.5-8.1-9.6, Howard University 7.2-7.5-7.3-8.1-8.1 Greater Washington Educational 6.4-5.5-5.4-5.5-4.4. Top Cume: WASH/FM A/C 780k. Top 5 Stations Dec/Holiday/January/February/March: WAMU News/Talk 9.5-8.3-13.4-10.2-9.7, WTOP/WTLP News 9.7-8.1-9.9-9.9-9.0, WHUR Urban A/C 7.2-7.5-7.3-8.1-8.1, WASH A/C 9.8-15.2-6.0-5.9-5.2, WBIG Classic Hits 3.3-4.7-5.1. March Change Range: +0.8, -2.1. Gainers: +0.8 WZMQ Country, +0.6 WLZL Tropical, +0.5 @ WMMJ Urban A/C & WGMS/FM Christian, +0.4 @ WBIG Classic Rock & WITH CHR. Dippers: -2.1 WMAL/FM News/Talk, -1.1 WETA Classical, -0.9 WTOP/TTLP News, -0.4 @ WIAD/FM Classic Hits & WPRS/FM Gospel. Formats: News/Talk 26.4-22.5-31.0-28.7-23.9, All A/C 20.3-27.8-18.8-18.6-19.6, Classic Rock/Classic Hits 9.2-7.0-8.4-8.8-9.6, Classical 6.4-5.5-5.7-6.0-4.8, Sports 3.0-2.4-2.2-3.6-2.6. Stream 0.4-0.3-0.2-0.1-0.1, HD 0.1-0.1-0.1-0.1-0.0.

PHILADELPHIA (9) 4,627,200. Urban 20.7%. Hispanic 9%. Top Clusters: Audacy 22.4-30.7-26.7-25.9-24.3, Beasley 24.1-19.2-22.1-21.0-23.6, iHeart 20.6-19.4-22.6-21.0-21.8, WHYY 4.7-4.6-6.3-5.2-4.6, Radio One 7.0-3.4-3.2-3.1-3.5. Top Cume: WBEB A/C 755-797-900k, ranks #6 share. Top 5 Stations add Sports WIP-AM: WDAS Urban A/C 8.3-8.4-8.6-8.0-8.1, WMMR Rock 6.5-6.1-6.3-7.6-7.0, KYW-AM/WPHI/FM News 4.9-5.4-6.4-6.5-6.0 ties WMGK Classic Rock 5.1-5.6-5.9-6.0, WIP-AM Sports 6.1-5.3-5.3. March Change Range: +1.0, -0.6. Gainers: +1.0 WXTU Country, +0.8 @ WIOQ CHR & WPP, + 0.7 WISX Soft A/C & WEMG-AM Tropical. Dippers: -0.6 @ WMMR Rock, WHYY News/Talk, -0.5 KYW/AM-WPHI/FM, -0.4 @ WBEB A/C, WUSL Urban, WRFF ModAlt Rock & Sports WPEN-FM. Formats: WOGL dips to #11 on #3 cume, shares ranking 7-10 are WXTY Country, WISX Soft A/C, WHYY News/Talk, WIOQ CHR. All A/C 23.3-27.3-22.2-19.8-21.2, News/Talk 13.2-13.9-16.8-15.6-14.2-15.9, Classic Rock/Classic & Adult Hits/Oldies 13.1-14.6-14.6-15.5, Sports 6.9-7.9-10.5-9.2-8.4, Classical 1.7-1.7-1.3. Stream 1.5-1.1. HD .1.

LONG ISLAND NY (20) 2,458,400. Hispanic 19%. Urban 10%. Top Clusters: Audacy 24.8-20.0-22.2-206-20.3, iHeart 21.6-25.7-21.1-16.5-20.1, Connoisseur 13.6-15.1-12.1-12.8-10.9, Apollo Cox 10.2-9.1-9.3-9.8-10.8. Top Cume: WHTZ 329-315-356k. Same Top 5 Stations: WBAB/WHFM Classic Rock 5.5-4.6-4.3-5.2-6.1, WAXQ Classic Rock 5.1-4.7-5.1-5.6-5.7, WCBS/FM 4.7-4.3-4.9-4.9-5.1, WBLI/FM CHR 4.4 4.2-4.3-4.4-4.5, WHTZ CHR 4.5-4.0-4.1-4.1. March Change Range: +0.9, -0.9. Gainers: +0.9 WBAB/WHFM Classic Rock, 0.4 @ WSKQ Tropical & WFAN Sports, +0.3 WNYC/FM News/Talk. Dippers: -0.9 WCBS-AM News, -0.6 WKTU Hot/AC, -0.5 @ WALK A/C & WWSK Rock, -0.3 WINS-AM News & WNEW/FM HotAC. Formats: Top 3 are Classic Rock/ Classic Hits. 9 of the Top 10 are music formats, 4 of the Top 10 are Long Island stations vs. NYC. WKYJ A/C beats former #1 sister WALK A/C 3.7 vs 3.1. Classic Rock/Classic Hits 20.8-16.2-17.3-19.0-21.0, All A/C 19.8-27.1-19.0-19.2-17.8. News/Talk 13.1-12.1-15.3 -9.4-8.5, Sports 5.9-6.1-7.2-6.0-6.6, Classical 0.8-0.6-0.8-0.6-.0.7, Jazz 0.2-0.1-0.0-0.2-0.3. Stream 1.7-1.6-1.7-1.5-0.5. HD 0.0-0.1-0.1.

BALTIMORE (22) 2,408,800. Urban 30%. Hispanic 6%. Top Clusters: iHeart 20.4-19.6-20.9-21.1-22.4, Radio One 15.2-16.0-16.0-16.4-17.6. Audacy 12.6-18.2-17.3-13.5-13.4, Hearst 11.0-9.6-9.9-9.1-9.0. Top Cume: WLIF-FM A/C 375-406k. Top 5 Stations: WWIN Urban A/C 8.1-9.1-9.1-9.4-10.0, WERQ Urban Contemporary 5.1-5.6-5.6-5.7-6.3, WPOC Country 6.7-5.4-5.5-5.4-5.9, WQSR Adult Hits 6.2-4.3-5.1, 5.0-5.7, WIYY Rock 5.6-4.9-5.1. March Change Range: +0.7, -1.4. Gainers: +0.7 WQSR Adult Hits, +0.6 @ WWIN/FM Urban A/C, WERQ Urban & WBJC Classical Stream, +0.5 WPOC Country, +0.4 @ WZFT CHR & WWMX Hot A/C. Dippers: -1.4 WYPR News/Talk, -0.6 WZBA Classic Rock, -0.5 WCBM News/Talk, -0.3 @ WLIF A/C, WHUR Urban A/C & WWDC ModAlt. Rock. Formats: All A/C 16.6-23.3-22.4-22.7-19.5, News/Talk 17.1-13.0-15.0-14.3-10.0, Classic Rock/Classic&Adult Hits/Oldies 10.7-7.8-11.4-10.3-10.0, Sports 3.2-3.4-5.1-3.8-3.6, Classical 2.0-1.4-2.1-1.6-2.4, Jazz 2.2-1.9-1.8-0.0-0.0, Stream 0.4-0.6-1.0-0.6-1.2. HD 1.0-0.7-0.4-0.3-1.1.

Of these Top 6 Northeast Markets, Entercom, now Audacy, repeats their wins in New York, Long Island and Philadelphia. iHeart tops Boston, Washington DC and Baltimore. In February, iHeart took Providence and, Audacy won Hartford.

FCC Licensed Radio proves to be the fastest, most efficient and cost-effective media to deliver factual news, positive entertainment, sports, information and sponsored messages. Content, Curation and Connection Create the Combined Communication.

Spring, Summer and the New Roaring ‘20s are poised to bring back healthy and more successful times. Many new formats, presentations and channels are available. Build it and they will come. Trend-setters, advertisers and the public interest will profit from all broadcast radio initiative.
